column4: howdy. so, i've managed to boot up using the live disk and it has found my wireless access point, but it won't connect to the internet.
do i need to add anything to the route table?
how can i check. an ifconfig only shows the router IP, i think
ifconfig should show the ip you were given if it worked. otherwise dhclient -k eth0;dhclient eth0
ifconfig -a shows eth1 with an IP belonging to my airport. i'll try the other  command. thanks
uh. ok
uh? you saying that because i'm missing something.
seems that eth1 is showing the IP DHCPed by my wireless router
but i still can't ping anything
good, then you should be on the internet if your router is working properly
ok
not even the router that gave you an ip?
i'll try the router.
router iis ponging back
but i can't ping, say, yahoo.com
DNS problem?
then you have a problem with the router... or bad dns resolvers
this is not really an #ubuntu issue and its been covered 3135475349023406734 times on google. look there
i'm IRCing through the same router from a OS X computer
google how to debug network issues linux
i don't know if it's ubuntu or not. i figure it's just clulessness on my part about linux in general. thanks for the pointer. i'll take it from here. i appreciate your help.
